result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R. Larsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

AODA and followthrough.
Any other programs/counseling and followthrough as determined by the agent.
Absolute sobriety.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment or job searches of 4 contacts per week.

timeConds.notes:
w/work release
No credit for time served.  No good time.
Need ATN - picture & prints.
May serve sentence in Langlade County if they can accommodate him.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas R. Larsen in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews a plea questionnaire.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  ADA White recites the joint recommendation.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty as a repeater.  Remarks by Atty. White and Atty. Weerts regarding sentence.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant Nicholas R. Larsen in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared late because he is in Huber in Langlade County and there was miscommunication on the time of court and when to release him.    Bond continues with all conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas R. Larsen in court with attorney Steven E. Weerts.  Defendant Nicholas R. Larsen in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives the preliminary hearing.  Court advises party of his right, accepts waiver and binds over.
absolute sobriety, can not leave State without court approval

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.
Defendant Nicholas R. Larsen appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Catharine D. White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 10:30 am.
